ivory.core.data.dictionary
Class PrefixEncodedLexicographicallySortedDictionary

java.lang.Object
  ivory.core.data.dictionary.PrefixEncodedLexicographicallySortedDictionary
All Implemented Interfaces:
Dictionary, LexicographicallySortedDictionary, Iterable<String>, Writable
public class PrefixEncodedLexicographicallySortedDictionary
extends Object
implements Writable, LexicographicallySortedDictionary

An implementation of LexicographicallySortedDictionary that encodes the dictionary with prefix encoding. Term ids start at 0, which corresponds to the first lexicographically-sorted term. Term id 1 is the second lexicographically-sorted term, etc. This dictionary is associated with a window size (cf. getWindowSize()), a parameter that controls how aggressively terms are stored based on their prefixes: for window size of n, every n-th word is stored verbatim (without prefix encoding). Larger window sizes lead to better compression, but slower lookups.

Author:
Jimmy Lin
